hanzi-su-wiki:
虜

Значения

Пленный

Мнемоника

Мужчина 男 под тигром 虍 (читай — военным), т.е. взятый в плен.

Варианты

虜, 虏

heisig_chinese_memo: They take captive the men and the tiger makes sure there are no escape attempts. &nbsp
heisig_constituent: captive, tiger, male, rice field, brains, power, muscle, arnold
Keyword_KANJIDIC: captive, barbarian, low epithet for the enemy
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: плен, варвар, низкий эпитет для противника
koohiiStory1: Captive men are thrown to the tigers. I think you can imagine something else is done to captive women...
koohiiStory2: Tip: To avoid confusing keyword captive with captured (#1018) note that captive contains "ti" for tiger.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: When a man meets a tiger he makes the tiger his captive. Men are pretty crappy like that. They see tigers and they want to put them in cages, so the poor tiger becomes a captive of the man.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture the sad tiger captive and the man laughing as he pokes at it. Tigers shouldn't be captives but when men find them they always seem to do this anyway.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The captive tiger is even sadder because the man put him in a robe (りょ) and is making him act like a human. Tigers look good in robes, but they don't really enjoy being forced into people clothing.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture the poor captive tiger being stuffed into a bathrobe and paraded around a cage for the man.
Ru_Meaning: captive, barbarian, low epithet for the enemy
Ru_Radicals: 力 (сила), 匕 (ложка), 卜 (гадание), 厂 (скала), 田 (рисовое поле), 虍 (тигр)
Ru_trainchinese: lǔ: (сущ/глаг) пленник, заключенный; (уничижит.) враг, северные народности; брать в плен
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the male (男) tiger (虍) is being held captive
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Humans have the mental muscle to take captive a sick tiger and help to heal it.
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscription from "虍" from " ◎ " from "力", used as a person's name. Send off the grandson: "Send the grandson to choose his auspicious gold, and make his own delicacy." (Explanation by Li Xueqin)

Chu Department of text from the " stripe of a tiger 'from the' no 'from the' force ', Xiaozhuan same. See the 19th slip of the Baoshan Chu Bamboo Slips "Lou [菐刂] 刂", used as a person's name. (He Linyi)

"Shuowen" is based on the original meaning of capture. "Shuowen": "Capture, get also. Never use strength, Shusheng." Such as "Zhuangzi. "Zeyang": "Yan, please receive 200,000 yuan, to attack him for the king, to captivate his people, and to be his cattle and horse." "Yan Ce III": "Qin general Wang Jian breaks Zhao, captive Zhao Wang, reclaim all the land."

" Captive " also means the captured person, that is, prisoner of war. Such as "Poetry. Daya. "Chang Wu": "Put Dun Huai Lian, but still hold the ugly captive." "Lu Shi Chun Qiu. "Shen Da": "Wang Wu wins over Yin and asks Yan when he gets the second captain."

" Captive " also extended to mean slave. Such as "The Songs of the Chu. Chapter Nine. Cherish the Past": "Wearing that Baili is a prisoner, Yi Yin cooked in the kitchen." "Historical Records. "Li Si Lie Biography": "Han Zi said: "Where are the people who "the kind mother has a lost son but the Yan family has no prisoners"?" Sima Zhensuoyin: "Ge, strong defense. Captives, slaves."
humanum_short_description_en: Bronze inscription from "虍" from " ◎ " from " force ". Chu Department of text from the " stripe of a tiger 'from the' no 'from the' force ', Xiaozhuan same. "Shuowen" is based on the original meaning of capture.
humanum_full_description:
金文從「虍」從「◎」從「力」，用作人名。發孫虜𠤳：「發孫虜擇其吉金，自作飤𠤳。」（李學勤釋文）

　　戰國楚系文字從「虍」從「毌」從「力」，小篆同。字形見包山楚簡第19簡「婁[菐刂]虜」，用為人名。（何琳儀）

　　《說文》以為本義是俘獲。《說文》：「虜，獲也。从毌从力，虍聲。」如《莊子．則陽》：「衍請受甲二十萬，為君攻之，虜其人民，係其牛馬。」《戰國策．燕策三》：「秦將王翦破趙，虜趙王，盡收其地。」

　　「虜」也表示俘獲的人，即戰俘。如《詩．大雅．常武》：「鋪敦淮濆，仍執醜虜。」《呂氏春秋．慎大》：「武王勝殷，得二虜而問焉。」

　　「虜」又引申表示奴隸。如《楚辭．九章．惜往日》：「聞百里之為虜兮，伊尹烹於庖廚。」《史記．李斯列傳》：「故韓子曰：『慈母有敗子而嚴家無格虜』者何也？」司馬貞索隱：「格，彊扞也。虜，奴隸也。」
humanum_short_description: 金文從「虍」從「◎」從「力」。戰國楚系文字從「虍」從「毌」從「力」，小篆同。《說文》以為本義是俘獲。

金文從「 虍 」從「 ◎ 」從「 力 」，用作人名。發孫虜𠤳：「發孫虜擇其吉金，自作飤𠤳。」（李學勤釋文） 戰國楚系文字從「 虍 」從「 毌 」從「 力 」，小篆同。字形見包山楚簡第19簡「婁[菐刂]虜」，用為人名。（何琳儀） 《說文》以為本義是俘獲。《說文》：「虜，獲也。从毌从力，虍聲。」如《莊子．則陽》：「衍請受甲二十萬，為君攻之，虜其人民，係其牛馬。」《戰國策．燕策三》：「秦將王翦破趙，虜趙王，盡收其地。」 「 虜 」也表示俘獲的人，即戰俘。如《詩．大雅．常武》：「鋪敦淮濆，仍執醜虜。」《呂氏春秋．慎大》：「武王勝殷，得二虜而問焉。」 「 虜 」又引申表示奴隸。如《楚辭．九章．惜往日》：「聞百里之為虜兮，伊尹烹於庖廚。」《史記．李斯列傳》：「故韓子曰：『慈母有敗子而嚴家無格虜』者何也？」司馬貞索隱：「格，彊扞也。虜，奴隸也。」

Never use strength, Shusheng." Such as "Zhuangzi. "Zeyang": "Yan, please receive 200,000 yuan, to attack him for the king, to captivate his people, and to be his cattle and horse." "Yan Ce III": "Qin general Wang Jian breaks Zhao, captive Zhao Wang, reclaim all the land." " Captive" also means the captured person, that is, prisoner of war. Such as "Poetry. Daya. "Chang Wu": "Put Dun Huai Lian, but still hold the ugly captive." "Lu Shi Chun Qiu. "Shen Da": "Wang Wu wins over Yin and asks Yan when he gets the second captain." 虜字的基本解释

虜
lǔ
见“虏”。

虜字的汉语字典释义

[①]［lǔ］
［《廣韻》郎古切，上姥，來。］
“虏1”的繁体字。
(1)俘获。
(2)掠夺。
(3)战俘，降服者。
(4)奴隶，仆役。
(5)指敌人；叛逆。
(6)古时对北方外族或南人对北方人的蔑称。

虜字的康熙字典解释

【申集中】【虍字部】　虜； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页1074第13
【唐韻】郞古切【集韻】【韻會】籠五切，?音魯。虜掠也。【漢書·晉灼註】生得曰虜，斬首曰獲。　又地名。【水經注】淄水又東逕臨淄縣故城，其外郭卽晉獻公所徙臨淄城也，世謂之虜城。　【六書正譌】生得者，則以索貫而拘之，故字从毌从力。俗从男，非。

虜字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
虜字的起名意思

暂无。

prisoner
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [lǔ]
["Guangyun" Lang Guqie, grandma, come. ]
The traditional characters of "維1".
(1) Capture.
(2) Plunder.
(3) Prisoners of war, survivors.
(4) Slaves, servants.
(5) Refers to the enemy; rebellious.
(6) In ancient times, the scornful term for the northern foreigners or the southerners to the northerners.
prisoner
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shenzhen Collection] [Feng Zi Department] 　瀀; Kangxi Strokes: 12; Page Number: Page 1074 Page 13
[Tang Yun] Yin Gu cut [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] Five cuts in cage,? Yinlu. Capture also. [Han Shu·Jin Zhuo Note] To be born is to be a prisoner, and to beheaded is to be taken.　Also place name. [Notes on Water Classics] Zishui is also east to the old city of Linzi County, outside of which Guo Yu Jinxian Gong emigrated to Linzi city, known as the city of the prisoners.　【Liushuzhengshu】Those who are born are constrained by stubbornness, so the word never complies with strength. Vulgar from male, non.

Name meaning

lǔ
вм. 虏
Radicals: 虍, 男  (tiger, man)
Meaning Mnemonic
When a man meets a tiger he makes the tiger his captive. Men are pretty crappy like that. They see tigers and they want to put them in cages, so the poor tiger becomes a captive of the man.
Picture the sad tiger captive and the man laughing as he pokes at it. Tigers shouldn't be captives but when men find them they always seem to do this anyway.
Reading Mnemonic
The captive tiger is even sadder because the man put him in a robe (りょ) and is making him act like a human. Tigers look good in robes, but they don't really enjoy being forced into people clothing.
Picture the poor captive tiger being stuffed into a bathrobe and paraded around a cage for the man.
